Audio Description:
A gray, black, and white image of the Statue of Liberty rises from the lower left corner of this poster about the United Nations. Only her head and right arm are seen. Dramatic lighting from below highlights her face with its resolute expression, her crown with six spiky rays and her right arm holding aloft a lit torch. At the top of the poster in white letters are the words “The United Nations fight for freedom.”  Below are images of the flags of the members of the United Nations: (from the top of the poster to the bottom):
the United States, Great Britain, Soviet Russia, China, Australia, Belgium, Brazil, Canada, Costa Rica, Cuba, Czechoslovakia, the Dominican Republic, El Salvador, Ethiopia, Greece, Guatemala, Haiti, Honduras India, Luxembourg, Mexico, the Netherlands, New Zealand, Nicaragua, Norway, Panama, the Philippines, Poland, South Africa, and Yugoslavia.
Creator: United States. Office of War Information;
Description: Poster, 71 x 56 cm, artist: S. Broder
Rights: Materials in this collection are made available by the Illinois State Library. To request reproductions or inquire about permissions, contact:  islimg@ilsos.net. Please cite the item title and collection name.
Subject [LCSH]: Allied Powers (1919-); United Nations; World War, 1939-1945; War posters, American
Title: The United Nations fight for freedom
